    • Spatial Data

    Spatial Data

    spatial_data.Rmd

    There is a ton (!) of spatial data on the portal. To access spatial data, you may need the sf and geojsonsf packages, depending on the resource.

    We can look at bicycle parking in Toronto. The result is an sf object with WGS84 projection.

    library(opendatatoronto)
library(dplyr)

bike_parking_racks <- search_packages("Bicycle Parking Racks") %>%
  list_package_resources() %>%
  filter(name == "Bicycle Parking Racks Data") %>%
  get_resource()

bike_parking_racks
#> Simple feature collection with 241 features and 30 fields
#> geometry type:  POINT
#> dimension:      XY
#> bbox:           xmin: -79.59575 ymin: 43.60367 xmax: -79.25724 ymax: 43.82303

#> proj4string:    +proj=longlat +datum=WGS84 +no_defs

    Using the cancensus package, we can plot the bike racks along with a map of Toronto!

    library(ggplot2)
#> Warning: package 'ggplot2' was built under R version 3.5.2
library(cancensus)
#> Warning: package 'cancensus' was built under R version 3.5.3

toronto <- get_census(
  dataset = "CA16", regions = list(CMA = "35535"),
  level = "CSD", geo_format = "sf", quiet = TRUE
)

ggplot() +
  geom_sf(data = toronto) +
  geom_sf(data = bike_parking_racks) +
  theme_minimal()
